intro: Pandanus senegalensis, commonly known as the West African screw pine, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and long, narrow leaves that are often spirally arranged. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences at the tips of the branches. Its roots are fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine. The plant is well adapted to coastal and saline environments, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
